title.rendered: DC captain Rishabh Pant will be out of IPL 2023: Sourav Ganguly

content.rendered:
Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has confirmed that DC captain Rishabh Pant will be out of the 2023 IPL because the keeper-batsman remains improving with his health from a vehicle twist of fate. (Read Also: India vs Sri Lanka 1st ODI 2023 highlights: Virat Kohli’s Century puts India ahead in 3 ODI series with 1-0)

On Dec 30, 2022, Pant met with a horrible vehicle twist of fate whilst going to Roorkee to see his mother. Pant suffered a couple of accidents withinside the twist of fate and is presently being dealt with at a medical institution in Mumbai. Pant turned into admitted to Mumbai-Kokilaben Ambani Hospital from Dehradun remaining week.

Ganguly’s update on Rishabh Pant’s availability for IPL 2023

“Delhi Capitals captain Rishabh Pant will now no longer be available for IPL 2023. I am associated with Delhi Capitals. It`s going to be an excellent IPL (for the team), We’ll do properly however Rishabh Pant’s harm will affect Delhi capitals,” Ganguly turned into lately quoted as announcing through Sports Today. Ganguly might himself be part of Delhi Capitals as Cricket Director for 2023- IPL season.

25-year-vintage Pant turned into an awful vehicle twist of fate at the Delhi-Dehradun toll road after his Mercedes crashed right into a wall.

Rishabh Pant is the captain of the Delhi Capitals. In his absence manner, the franchise is now seeking out a captain to guide them at the approaching IPL 2023. He may also leave out many tournaments for India, to affect his participation withinside the ICC World Cup later this year.

“DC captain Rishabh Pant has cuts on his forehead. A torn ligament in his proper knee and additionally injured his proper wrist, ankle, toe, and lower back abrasions,” the BCCI stated in a declaration past week.
